description.narrative: This multi-pillared Pilot project, in a holistic and complimentary approach, aims at improving social cohesion, encouraging and creating safe cultural spaces for plurality of voices and building resilience among several groups of stakeholders. It is seated in thelong term strategy of Armanshahr and further builds on its track record of dedication to defending a democratic environment by encouraging the shaping of a community of informed and committed citizens. The activities are built on and take to a new level, successful Actions, cultural spaces and productions by Armanshahr in more than a decade in Afghanistan. The Pilot Project aims at creating platforms, introducing new initiatives and expanding and reinforcing established and new networks between individuals, communities and institutions, allowing youth, teachers, schools, women#s# rights defenders, social activists, artists, cultural entrepreneurs, and civil society and human rights community members to express themselves and form knowledgeable opinions about the most fundamental issues touching their lives and that of their community and to exchange in a creative, concerted, participatory and safe civil spaces.

participating-org.narrative:
Armanshahr/OPEN ASIA is a non-governmental, not-for-profit and independent organization, committed to defending a democratic environment by encouraging the shaping of a community of informed and committed citizens. It brings together progressive minds and actionsbenefiting a culture of Human rights and women's empowerment and supporting the demands of citizens for democracy, women#s equality, justice and rule of law in Afghanistan, and in the heart of Asia.
Armanshahr Foundation was registered in Kabul, Afghanistan as an independent non-governmental and non-profit Social Organization with the Ministry of Justice of Afghanistan in 2006 and with the Ministry of Economy of Afghanistan as Armanshahr Afghanistan Studies Organization (ASASO) in 2010.
Armanshahr makes use of work methodologies, experience and support from its network sister organizations OPEN ASIA which was founded in Tajikistan in 1996 and OPEN ASIA France, registered in Paris since 2000.
The commitment of Armanshahr to sustain a democratic environment through the promotion of the civil society, dialogue, culture, human and women#s rights is carried out in various ways:
1. Organizing forums of dialogue, conferences, trainee seminars In cooperation with many actors of the civilsociety, civic debates, largely covered by the national media, is organized. Concretely, since 2006, 173 seminars on contemporary issues with the participation of more than 500 experts and some 30,000 people, mainly Youth, is successfully held. Armanshahr has been the organizer of FOUR successful rounds of the December Human Rights Week in Kabul with workshops, expert round tables, performances, concerts, publications. (http://openasia.org/item/category/conference/armanshahr-public-seminars)
2. Cultural Platforms and Activities Since 2013, Armanshahr founded and organized FOUR successful Editions of the International Women#s Film Festival-Herat, in cooperation with Roya Film House, (http://openasia.org/item/category/international-womens-film-festival/). Since 2009 the Simorgh Peace Prize: public call for distinguished personalitiesand initiatives in the fields of literature, culture and art works against war and discrimination is organized every 30 months. (http://openasia.org/item/category/simorgh-peace-prize).
Numerous other cultural initiatives and locally adapted activities: production and development of plays and performances, concerts, cinematographic cycles, poetry <(>&<)> prose events and Youth reading clubs.
3. Publishing Armanshahr Publishing is a unique non-profit Publishing House specialized in the promotion of human rights through culture. It is the only Publishing House working in this domain in Afghanistan. Armanshahr has published some 130 titles (200,000 prints) in 6 series reaching a diverse public. The series include Women (Gender Studies), Goftegu (Debate), Let#s break the Silence (Human Rights), Simorgh (Literature), Children and Youth and Politics-Asia; a Journal of Contemporary Studies.
Armanshahr also produces a bilingual newsletter. To this date, Armanshahr published 185 issues of Armanshahr Human Rights and Civil Society Journal and publishes 3 days of the week a different Human Rights Watch e-Bulletin (+430 issues) covering Afghanistan, Women and the Internationalaffairs scene, reaching a public of 100,000 receivers weekly.
4. Media and social networks # Four types of activities: 1) production by Armanshahr of multimedia programs (documentary films such as Afghanistan Unveiling a Never-ending Tale on YOUTUBE HERE , I (EYE) Witness , and interviews with opinion-makers, radio programs, media Campaigns such as the 100 Day Campaign leading to the elections of the #Unveiling Afghanistan: the Unheard Voices of progress Campaign# (published in 8 Subh and Huffington Post), 2) active bilingual website and an online Human Rights resource center, a strong presence in various social networks (50,000 members including Facebook Page, YOUTUBE channel with more than 1000 documents) and Special Website for the International Women#s Film Festival-Herat and contribution to FIDH Persian pages on website; 3) support to and cooperation with media agencies and companies of the region; 4) cooperation with international media (RFI, BBC, Deutsche Welle, Voice of America, Radio Zamaneh...).
5. National and International Advocacy Armanshahr is a co/founder of several advocacy groups and initiatives including the Transitional Justice Coordination Group, the +25% Women#s Quota Campaign, the Unveiling Afghanistan Campaign and WASL(Women Alliance for Security Leadership) among others.
In close cooperation with the FIDH, Armanshahr, which is a league member of the 187 Human rights worldwide network, conducts communication and public relations campaigns in favor of human rights and women#s rights to national and international bodies bi-annually (European Union, UN Human Rights Council, UN Security Council, International Criminal Court, UN Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women, NATO, etc.).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
